channel.title: System file corrupted! 0_o uh oh
channel.description:
Hi about 3 weeks ago my good computer effed up. I downloaded a game and it wasnt complete then decided to open it, it then gave me a error. then my pc was freezing up, so i decided to plug it out. then i start it back up, just to see some BS about winnt\system32\config\SYSTEM file being corrupted.
i m using windows 2k and NFTS file system. And i dont own the windows 2000 cd anymore. So i gotta use a windows 2k boot disk to fix this but idk how to use it. post the exact commands to copy system to system.old and system.alt to system plz and how what option in the boot menu would i need to use to repair it? and if u want u can tell me something different to do to fix this.

item.title: System file corrupted! 0_o uh oh
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

I dunno how that can help, but I suck at java, but the coffee is good.

Read full topic

item.title: System file corrupted! 0_o uh oh
item.dc:creator: @Mattymat1313 Mattymat1313
item.description:
@Mattymat1313 wrote:

ok thanks thats all the help i need, vb7 ur the best ^___^. i should be back to playing gta san andreas online in noo time :D[br][size=1]Posted on: August 09, 2007, 01:20:23 PM[/size][hr]oh wait, i’ve recently seen some guys vid on mopar on how to setup java jdk and his video said something on adding in java paths, so i added em in and after about a couple of days later i started getting these errors. And you know how your whole registry and whatnot has a certain limit to how big of a size is supposed to be? i think adding in these paths made it exceed that limit and caused my pc to not boot because of the limitation it went over… do u think that was the problem?

Read full topic

item.title: System file corrupted! 0_o uh oh
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“Mattymat1313, post:10, topic:131712”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=182514.msg1663252#msg1663252 date=1186704280]

3rd time editing:

ok first of all you guys do know that when you boot windows properly, the system file is backed up as a system.alt just in case u need to replace the corrupted system file. so what i wanna do is rename the system file to system.old and system.alt to system. how would i do this using a boot disk?

Tell your BIOS to boot from the boot disk
on the boot disk menu boot into command prompt
type these commands pressing enter after each one:

[tt]
ren system system.old
ren system.alt system
[/tt]

That should rename your system file to system.old, then rename system.alt to system. (I think that’s what you asked, right?)
[/quote]

ok that solves the how to rename part, but how do i do this in the winnt\system32\config
directory??[/quote]

[tt]
cd C:\winnt\system32\config
ren system system.old
ren system.alt system
[/tt]

If winnt isn’t in C:, just change the C:\ part to whatever it is.

Read full topic

Tell your BIOS to boot from the boot disk
